messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How far am I from the Golden Gate Bridge
To calculate the distance, I’ll need to know your current location (either a city, an address, or latitude/longitude coordinates). Could you share that, please?
I don't have my current location info.

No problem! To figure out the distance, I’ll need at least an approximate idea of where you are—anything from a city name to a ZIP code, street address, or a pair of GPS coordinates. Whatever you’re comfortable sharing will work. Could you give me a rough location?
I honestly don't have that info right now.

Understood. Unfortunately, calculating a distance requires two points—the destination (Golden Gate Bridge) and a starting point (your location). If you can get even a rough idea of where you are (e.g., “downtown Sacramento,” “ZIP 90001,” “near Portland, OR,” etc.), I can estimate the distance right away. 

If you don’t have that information handy, here are a few ways you could quickly find it:

• On a phone: Open any map app (Apple Maps, Google Maps). Your blue “current-location” dot will show coordinates or at least a city/area name you can share.

• On a computer: Visit “Where Am I?” GPS websites (e.g., mylocation.org); they’ll show your approximate latitude/longitude.

• If you know a nearby landmark, city, or even a county, letting me know that lets me give you a ballpark figure.

Whenever you have any rough location details, just tell me and I can calculate the distance to the Golden Gate Bridge for you.
If you have difficulty still, try turning on location services or access a map app to know where you currently are, and provide it.

I’m sorry, but I don’t have the ability to detect anyone’s physical location or activate location services on your device. If you can share even a rough idea of where you are—such as a city, ZIP code, or nearby landmark—I’d be happy to estimate the distance to the Golden Gate Bridge for you.
